title: Woman shot up a Kentucky KFC because she didn't get a fork or napkin
text:
Kentucky authorities are searching for a woman who witnesses claim shot up a KFC drive thru because they failed to give her a napkin and a fork with her meal.

Investigators were dispatched by Shelby County to look into a shooting that took place on Monday at the Shelbyville KFC.

'Sorry for the inconveinence but we are currently closed,' a sign read on KFC's door as of Monday evening, WLKY reports.

Witnesses in the area said that a woman shot through KFC's window after she didn't receive the napkin and fork

Investigators were dispatched by Shelby County to look into a shooting that took place on Monday at the Shelbyville KFC

Witnesses in the area said that a woman shot through KFC's window after she didn't receive the napkin and fork.

'I just can't even think about what was going through their head to pull out a gun and shoot a window. It's scary,' said Charlene Witt, a manager for a nearby Subway.

Witt shared that she was inside the Subway at the time of the shooting.

'I had a regular customer come in and say, "Did you hear about what just happened at KFC?" I was, like, "No." He was, like, 'Someone just shot the window out over here,' Witt explained.

KFC shared in a statement that it was grateful that no one was injured. They reopened on Tuesday

KFC shared in a statement that it was grateful that no one was injured.

'We are working with local authorities as they investigate the incident,' the popular chicken chain added.

KFC said that it would reopen on Tuesday.

Police are still looking for information pertaining to the suspect.
description: Investigators were dispatched by Shelby County to look into a shooting that took place on Monday at the Shelbyville KFC.
